content.description: Climb this right trending line with large jugs and huecos.
content.location:
This is in between the

left V0

and the

left V5

.

content.description: Start on the left arete and climb straight up using the large jugs and huecos on the right.
content.location:
This is located on the far left side of the wall. About 10 feet left of the

Left V5

.

content.description: Start in a large hueco. Make a large right handed move to a pocket, then straight up to good ledges. Then start moving right using good ledges and jugs. The top may be a bit sandy, so be careful.
content.location: This is on the right side of the wall.

content.description: Start matched in the jug hueco at head height. Paste your feet on underneath or fire a big campus move to a good right hand crimp. Finish up and right along a large, left-facing line of jug blocks. Delicate climbing and a light climber may be key as all of the gigantic blocks at 15' or so are very hollow sounding. Pull down, not out!
content.protection: Pads and spotter. The landing is clean, but I wouldn't even consider climbing this anytime after a rain in fear of dislodging one of the massive blocks on the finish.
content.location:
It is left of

Unknown V3

and right of

Right Unknown

, V5. Look for a large jug hueco about head height.

content.description: Sit start on a rail and head up using jugs. The crux is swinging from the overhang and pulling over the bulge to an easy top out.
content.location: Head up the hill a little ways sticking to the lower side of the ridge from the other problems. It looks like a tiny amphitheater facing the road before the large face with anchors.

content.description:
Alas, you probably won't find this problem in the same conditions that I did.  Even as I climbed, it was still shedding rotten rock between the starting hold and the solid rock at head-height.

Starting on excellent underclings find something solid and make your way right to a large sloping sidepull (lots of good toe-hooks to help).  A tough move gets you into solid holds and huecos above.  I didn't top it out, but that's just me....
content.location: This is the right line in the beta photo.

content.description:
Starting on excellent underclings, make your way up to a jug ledge - either via a sloping crimp on the right or a sidepull on the left.  Continue up solid holds and huecos.  This felt safe enough to top out.

True name?
content.location: This is the left line in the beta photo.
